Misconfigurations.Title: Manage configmaps
Misconfigurations.Description: Some workloads leverage configmaps to store sensitive data or configuration parameters that affect runtime behavior that can be modified by an attacker or combined with another issue to potentially lead to compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: Role 'che-operator-leader-election' should not have access to resource 'configmaps' for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove write permission verbs for resource 'configmaps'

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: role che-operator-leader-election in eclipse-che namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: rolebinding che-operator-leader-election in eclipse-che namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: issuer che-operator-selfsigned-issuer in eclipse-che namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: service che-operator-service in eclipse-che namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: certificate che-operator-serving-cert in eclipse-che namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the cluster-scope is akin to cluster-admin in most clusters as there are typically at least one service accounts (their token stored in a secret) bound to cluster-admin directly or a role/clusterrole that gives similar permissions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' shouldn't have access to manage resource 'secrets'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the cluster-scope is akin to cluster-admin in most clusters as there are typically at least one service accounts (their token stored in a secret) bound to cluster-admin directly or a role/clusterrole that gives similar permissions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' shouldn't have access to manage resource 'secrets'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the cluster-scope is akin to cluster-admin in most clusters as there are typically at least one service accounts (their token stored in a secret) bound to cluster-admin directly or a role/clusterrole that gives similar permissions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' shouldn't have access to manage resource 'secrets'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: No wildcard verb roles
Misconfigurations.Description: Check whether role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Message: Role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Create a role which does not permit wildcard verb on specific resources

Misconfigurations.Title: No wildcard verb roles
Misconfigurations.Description: Check whether role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Message: Role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Create a role which does not permit wildcard verb on specific resources

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes workloads and pods
Misconfigurations.Description: Depending on the policies enforced by the admission controller, this permission ranges from the ability to steal compute (crypto) by running workloads or allowing for creating workloads that escape to the node as root and escalation to cluster-admin.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' should not have access to resources ["pods", "deployments", "jobs", "cronjobs", "statefulsets", "daemonsets", "replicasets", "replicationcontrollers"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Kubernetes workloads resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes workloads and pods
Misconfigurations.Description: Depending on the policies enforced by the admission controller, this permission ranges from the ability to steal compute (crypto) by running workloads or allowing for creating workloads that escape to the node as root and escalation to cluster-admin.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' should not have access to resources ["pods", "deployments", "jobs", "cronjobs", "statefulsets", "daemonsets", "replicasets", "replicationcontrollers"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Kubernetes workloads resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' should not have access to resources ["pods", "deployments", "jobs", "cronjobs", "statefulsets", "daemonsets", "replicasets", "replicationcontrollers"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Kubernetes workloads resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage configmaps
Misconfigurations.Description: Some workloads leverage configmaps to store sensitive data or configuration parameters that affect runtime behavior that can be modified by an attacker or combined with another issue to potentially lead to compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' should not have access to resource 'configmaps' for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove write permission verbs for resource 'configmaps'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes RBAC resources
Misconfigurations.Description: An effective level of access equivalent to cluster-admin should not be provided.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' should not have access to resources ["roles", "rolebindings"] for verbs ["create", "update", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove write permission verbs for resource 'roles' and 'rolebindings'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes RBAC resources
Misconfigurations.Description: An effective level of access equivalent to cluster-admin should not be provided.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' should not have access to resources ["roles", "rolebindings"] for verbs ["create", "update", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove write permission verbs for resource 'roles' and 'rolebindings'

Misconfigurations.Title: Exec into Pods
Misconfigurations.Description: The ability to exec into a container with privileged access to the host or with an attached SA with higher RBAC permissions is a common escalation path to cluster-admin.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' should not have access to resource '["pods/exec"]' for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove write permission verbs for resource 'pods/exec'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes networking
Misconfigurations.Description: The ability to control which pods get service traffic directed to them allows for interception attacks. Controlling network policy allows for bypassing lateral movement restrictions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' should not have access to resources ["services", "endpoints", "endpointslices", "networkpolicies", "ingresses"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Networking resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes networking
Misconfigurations.Description: The ability to control which pods get service traffic directed to them allows for interception attacks. Controlling network policy allows for bypassing lateral movement restrictions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' should not have access to resources ["services", "endpoints", "endpointslices", "networkpolicies", "ingresses"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Networking resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes networking
Misconfigurations.Description: The ability to control which pods get service traffic directed to them allows for interception attacks. Controlling network policy allows for bypassing lateral movement restrictions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'che-operator' should not have access to resources ["services", "endpoints", "endpointslices", "networkpolicies", "ingresses"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Networking resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: clusterrole che-operator in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: clusterrolebinding che-operator in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs as root user
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the running image to run as a non-root user to ensure least privileges.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'che-operator' of Deployment 'che-operator' should set 'securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsNonRoot' to true.

Misconfigurations.Title: Root file system is not read-only
Misconfigurations.Description: An immutable root file system prevents applications from writing to their local disk. This can limit intrusions, as attackers will not be able to tamper with the file system or write foreign executables to disk.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'che-operator' of Deployment 'che-operator' should set 'securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to true
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Change 'containers[].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem' to 'true'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with UID <= 10000
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'che-operator' of Deployment 'che-operator' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with GID <= 10000
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'che-operator' of Deployment 'che-operator' should set 'securityContext.runAsGroup' > 10000
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to an integer > 10000.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runtime/Default Seccomp profile not set
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Seccomp', the RuntimeDefault seccomp profile must be required, or allow specific additional profiles.
Misconfigurations.Message: Either Pod or Container should set 'securityContext.seccompProfile.type' to 'RuntimeDefault'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'spec.securityContext.seccompProfile.type', 'spec.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' and 'spec.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile' to 'RuntimeDefault' or undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Seccomp policies disabled
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies.
Misconfigurations.Message: container che-operator of deployment che-operator in eclipse-che namespace should specify a seccomp profile
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: deployment che-operator in eclipse-che namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Delete pod logs
Misconfigurations.Description: Used to cover attacker’s tracks, but most clusters ship logs quickly off-cluster.
Misconfigurations.Message: Role 'che-operator' should not have access to resource 'pods/log' for verbs ["delete", "deletecollection", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove verbs 'delete' and 'deletecollection' for resource 'pods/log' for Role and ClusterRole

Misconfigurations.Message: Role permits wildcard verb on specific resources
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Create a role which does not permit wildcard verb on specific resources

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage namespace secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the namespace scope can lead to escalation if another service account in that namespace has a higher privileged rolebinding or clusterrolebinding bound.
Misconfigurations.Message: Role 'che-operator' shouldn't have access to manage secrets in namespace 'eclipse-che'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage namespace secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from role
